comments:
While debugging a JUnit test case I got the following log.
The test case produced a lot of output to System.err and System.out.
The !ENTRY occured about 100.000 times in about 15 minutes. An error dialog 
came up and I never get rid of this. Every time I closed it, it came up again. 
Only kill the process helps.
I use Eclipse 3.1M2
!SESSION Nov 02, 2004 10:44:55.980 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200409240800
java.version=1.5.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -showlocation

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Nov 02, 2004 10:44:55.980
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Match Job".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Illegal start index
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.find(Matcher.java:552)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.console.IOConsolePartitioner$MatchJob.run
(IOConsolePartitioner.java:808)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

This support has changed a lot between 3.1M2 and 3.1M3. Can you see if the 
problem occurrs on M3?
Marking as works for me without test case.
